document.heading: Veterans License Plates Authorization Amendment Act of 2010

history.narrative: Law 18-309, the “Veterans License Plates Authorization Amendment Act of 2010”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 18-235, which was referred to the Committees on Aging and Community Affairs, and Public Works and Transportation. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 9, 2010, and November 23, 2010, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 9, 2010, it was assigned Act No. 18-630 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 18-309 became effective on March 12, 2011.

meta.search-text: ENROLLED ORIGINAL 1Codification District of Columbia Official Code, 2001 Edition AN ACT IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA To amend the District of Columbia Revenue Act of 1937 to authorize the issuance of veterans’ motor vehicle identification tags, including the establishment of display fees and eligibility criteria, and to require that the application fee and display fees shall be deposited in the Office of Veterans Affairs Fund, which is used to provide programs and services to the District of Columbia veterans. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the “Veterans License Plates Authorization Amendment Act of 2010”. Sec. 2. Title IV of the District of Columbia Revenue Act of 1937, approved August 17, 1937 (50 Stat. 673; D.C. Official Code § 50-1501.01 et seq is amended as follows a) A new section 2a is added to read as follows: “Sec. 2a. Issuance of Veterans License Plates. “(a) For the purposes of this section, the term “veteran” means an individual who has: “(1)(A) Served on active duty in the armed forces of the United States; or “(B) Been a member of the National Guard and Reserves; “(2)(A) Been called to active duty authorized by the President of the United States or the Secretary of Defense; or “(B) Had at least 20 years of service with a letter and record of separation of service; and “(3) Been discharged or released under conditions other than dishonorable. “(b)(1) The Mayor shall issue a registration certificate and identification tags for a passenger motor vehicle (other than a passenger vehicle for hire) to an individual who is a veteran or the spouse of a veteran, is a District resident, and applies for the registration certificate and identification tags in lieu of those required by section 2. Upon the death of a veteran that is a holder of identification tags issued under this section, the identification tags shall be transferred, upon application, to the surviving spouse for the spouses’s lifetime or until he or she remarries. “(2) The Mayor shall design and make available for issue one or more veterans’ identification tags, and establish an application process for the issue of these identification tags. Codification District of Columbia Official Code 2001 Edition 2011 Winter Supp. ENROLLED ORIGINAL 2Codification District of Columbia Official Code, 2001 Edition Any veteran or spouse of a veteran who orders a veterans’ identification tag shall pay a one- time application fee and a display fee each year thereafter. The application fee shall be $52 and the display fee shall be $26, or other amounts as may be established by the Mayor by rule. The application fee and annual display fee shall be deposited in the Office of Veterans Affairs Fund, established by section 705 of the Office of Veterans Affairs Establishment Act of 2001, effective October 3, 2001 (D.C.
